column4: Someone please tell me why I can not extract linux-source-2.6.10.tar.bz2, I get (bzip2: Data integrity error when decompressing.)  And the command I am using is sudo tar --bzip2 -xvf linux-2.6.12.tar.bz2
sounds like it might be corrupted
I have tried to get it from kernel.org and get the same problem, where can I get it reliably?
try tar -xjvf ...otherwise, how are you downloading it?
same place...what are you downloading it with?
I have tried from kernel.org, where else can i get it?
do you have a local mirror of kernel.org?   where are you??
have a look here http://www.kernel.org/mirrors/...use wget -c ...that continues if you have to stop it for any reason
I get the exact same errors, even when i downloaded the sources from a Canadian Mirror
sudo tar --bzip2 -xvf linux-2.6.10.tar.bz2 is what I am trying to use, but no matter what I am not able to decompress the archive
this is weird...somrthing is corrupting you downloads...wont be the mirrors
what do you think can be the problem?
I checked the archive on another PC and the archive is not corrupted, just this machine can not uppack it... any idea why that is?
